subject: Re: [junit] TestSuite Help
msgSnippet: ... 1. Create a new class. 2. Add a custom suite() method. public class JustThreeTests { public static Test suite() { //... } } 3. Create a suite with just
messageBody:
vgkkonda wrote:

> In a class I have 5 testcases now i dont want to run all 5 test
> cases. I want to run only 3 test cases say test1 test3 test5 cases
> how this can be done.

1. Create a new class.
2. Add a "custom suite() method."

public class JustThreeTests {
public static Test suite() {
//...
}
}

3. Create a suite with just those three tests.

public class JustThreeTests {
public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite("Your descriptive name here");

suite.addTest(new MyTestCase("test1"));
suite.addTest(new MyTestCase("test3"));
suite.addTest(new MyTestCase("test5"));

return suite;
}
}

Now run the test runner on JustThreeTests. Done.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
